title: Powell Promises Diverse Candidates Will Get Shot at Boston, Dallas Fed Openings
sub_head: The Fed has faced criticism for a lack of diversity in its ranks
body:
Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said that the central bank will strive to make sure women and minority candidates are included as two regional Fed banks look to fill leadership positions.
“I can absolutely guarantee you that we will work hard in both of those processes to find and give a fair shot to diverse candidates for those two jobs,” Mr. Powell said before a House panel on Thursday. “It’ll be a big focus of both, both of those processes,” he said. Fed bank presidents are selected by their local boards of directors...
